ai-ud1.1:1.2_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of a Bodhi tree on the bank of the river Nerañjara at the foot of a Bodhi tree.
ai-ud1.1:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was sitting cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ai-ud1.1:1.4_0: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion. In the first part of the night, he reflected on dependent origination in forward order:
ai-ud1.1:2.1_0: “When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises. That is:
ai-ud1.1:2.2_0: Due to the arising of this, that arises.
ai-ud1.1:2.3_0: ignorance is a condition for choices.
ai-ud1.1:2.5_0: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
ai-ud1.1:2.6_0: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields
ai-ud1.1:2.7_0: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
ai-ud1.1:2.8_0: Contact is a condition for feeling.
ai-ud1.1:2.9_0: Feeling is a condition for craving;
ai-ud1.1:2.10_0: Craving is a condition for grasping.
ai-ud1.1:2.11_0: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
ai-ud1.1:2.12_0: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
ai-ud1.1:2.13_0: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
ai-ud1.1:2.14_0: This is how there is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.”
ai-ud1.1:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.1:4.4_0: since he understands each thing and its cause.”
ai-ud1.1:4.5_0: First the first part of the body.
